snippet: Thirteen months after he was released from prison, the former baseball All-Star leapt from topic to topic in an interview, making clear his wish for another chance at credibility and wealth.
abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column highlights former major leaguer Lenny Dykstra, who is hoping for another chance at credibility and wealth as an investment adviser after serving six-and-a-half-month sentence in federal prison for bankruptcy fraud and other charges in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Thirteen months after he was released from prison, the former baseball All-Star leapt from topic to topic in an interview, making clear his wish for another chance at credibility and wealth.

headline.print_headline: Out of Prison, and Still Headstrong
headline.main: Lenny Dykstra: Out of Prison, and Still Headstrong
